intro: Lepidium heterophyllum var. vazquezii, commonly known as the Vázquez's cress, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and specialized growth habits. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh habitat. Its leaves are usually basal, with a hairy texture that aids in water retention. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
